sentences: Kui sa oleksid vaba homme, me v천iksime kohtuda.
Oleksin v채ga r천천mus, kuid sa tulles.
context: "Oleksid" is the conditional form of the verb "olema" (to be) in Estonian. It specifically refers to the second person singular conditional mood, meaning "you would be" or "if you were". This form is used in hypothetical situations, wishes, or polite suggestions. The word combines the stem "ole-" with the suffix "-ksid" which indicates the conditional mood and second person subject.
